column4: I am unable to access the wireless Router web-page which is set to 192.168.1.1 even after repeated attempts. What can I do ??? Its a problem with my Ubuntu laptop only. The page is accessible from Windows PCs otherwise...
what brand of router
Its a linksys router.
open a terminal: ping 192.168.1.1 and then ping 4.2.2.2
which works, which don't
Both are pinging properly. 0 packet Loss...
tracert 4.2.2.2       - what's your first hop
192.168.1.1 and 4.2.2.2 both are pinging properly
two things you can try http://192.168.1.1:81 and http://192.168.1.1:8080 and http://192.168.1.1:800
the first hop is 192.168.1.1
the first hop is 192.168.1.1
try those links i gave you
The :80 page loaded the title but not the rest. Could it also be because it extensively uses Java... Though i have java 6 installed..
it might be a java issue, are you trying in firefox?
The three pages dont work...
Yes..
Its working even on my mobile's wireless... Dono y not on the system.. :(
I'd see if it worked in lynx or opera and then complain to linksys/mozilla about it
it could just be a whack bug, is the firmware up to date on the router?
also make sure you're not running any addons in firefox when you're doing it, adblockers et al might prohibit certain functionality
Yes.. Hey, does opera work on ubuntu ???
my girlfriend uses opera on ubuntu 8.04
